instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3437-B slow
threads.message:
Hi!

I have this 820-3437-B board that suddenly (no drops, no water damage) run slowly (with fan spinning high loading os), 
but sometimes it starts and work perfectly fine for days at full speed.

What i can start checking?

Thanks!

threads.title: 820-3437-B slow
threads.message: Run ASD 156 EFI version and set it to continue on error. See which sensors are failing.

threads.title: 820-3437-B slow
threads.message:
Try known good LIO board/flex, as TP too.
Also inspect both connectors for corrosion.
Run ASD when doesn't work correctly, or just monitor temperatures with HWMonitor.

threads.title: 820-3437-B slow
threads.message:
I get an error on sensor TC0P (Cpu proximity)
Sensor is reading below the low limit

edit: same with TCHP and TS2P

threads.title: 820-3437-B slow
threads.message:
"[I]Temperature (TS2P) -- S2 Camera Proximity [/I]"
Check for corrosion at camera connector.

threads.title: 820-3437-B slow
threads.message: If error remains without the camera plugged in, then inspect inputs and outputs to U5800. I had one similar the other day with a bad U5800.

threads.title: 820-3437-B slow
threads.message:
Did you try disconnecting camera?
ALS sensor is connected on the same bus with the rest of temp sensors.

threads.title: 820-3437-B slow
threads.message:
Disconnecting camera everything works fine!
I have to check U5800 as John says or i start checking camera cable and components inside the screen?

threads.title: 820-3437-B slow
threads.message:
U5800 is OK then.
I don't think the client is interested about ALS sensor.

threads.title: 820-3437-B slow
threads.message:
No, but it uses the camera...
Checking J4002 PIN 4 is shorted to ground, i will check R4030 and R4031, am i right?
Thanks

threads.title: 820-3437-B slow
threads.message: If it works without the camera, I?d advise customer to live without it. Fixing camera is a nightmare

threads.title: 820-3437-B slow
threads.message: Leave camera connected, only cut off traces to pins 8/9.

threads.title: 820-3437-B slow
threads.message:
Cutted traces to pins 8/9 and passed afi asd without errors.
Thanks!
